poem:
Title: The Fickle Mask of Fair Trade

In the quiet morning, a titan
surrenders-
green tendrils wilt, uprooted.
The body shop of ethics 
and oils- bathed in 
bereavement.
No more- pert faces, glistening
under sunflower kisses;
robust risings of commerce,
vulnerable.
Crucial lives, tangled in exchange,
now sway
on the precipice of uncertainty.
Fallen creed-
a lament in lavender.
